item.title: Random Day on 5/28 at The Composition Shop
item.content:encoded:
I’m going to have a Random Day on 5/28 at The Composition Shop in Longmont. I plan to be there from 11 am to 5 pm with a break for a lunch meeting from 1 pm to 2:30 pm. We will have copies of Give First: The Power of Mentorship in the store on sale, […]

The post Random Day on 5/28 at The Composition Shop appeared first on Feld Thoughts.

item.title: Back in Boulder
item.content:encoded:
As a proud early Gen Xer, I was in ninth grade when Back in Black came out. It was my favorite song for at least a week, and it’s still in my top 10 (something by Rush likely displaced it.) As a teenager, I knew everything about AC/DC (at least everything you could know before […]

The post Back in Boulder appeared first on Feld Thoughts.

item.title: My Upcoming Events in Boulder
item.content:encoded:
Now that I’m out of hibernation for a while and back in Boulder for a month, I’m doing a bunch of public events. My approach, in general, is fireside chats or AMAs, so that’ll be the rhythm rather than me getting up in front of a crowd and blathering about something for 30 to 45 […]

The post My Upcoming Events in Boulder appeared first on Feld Thoughts.

item.title: This Week In Vibe Coding Learning
item.content:encoded:
Question: If you had limited experience with graphic design software but wanted to do basic stuff for web design, what software would you use? Leave the answers in the comments or email me. As I play around with Vibe coding, I’ve decided to take a new topic each week. For context, look at my Dinostroids: […]

item.title: Book: Carrie Soto Is Back
item.content:encoded:
I had a weird, unsatisfying, and not particularly restful weekend because of Colorado politics and post-exertional malaise. So, in between work, a short run, a long nap, a bunch of online Swedish death cleaning, and lying on the couch responding to endless text messages, I read Carrie Soto Is Back and The Big Gamble (Kevin […]

item.title: The Cost of Passive Avoidance
item.content:encoded:
It’s pre-order time for Give First: The Power of Mentorship. If you find this post’s topic interesting, help boost my input into the Amazon algorithm by pre-ordering the book. I’ve failed at many things. Anyone with a lot of success has also had plenty of failure. If a successful person denies this, they are lying. Reflecting […]

The post The Cost of Passive Avoidance appeared first on Feld Thoughts.

item.title: Startup Community Trailblazer Brad Feld to Release New Book at GEC 2025
item.content:encoded:
“Startup Community Trailblazer” is a fancy title for me, but I’ll take it. I’ve decided to attend the Global Entrepreneurship Congress 2025 in Indianapolis to launch Give First: The Power of Mentorship. I’ll be there from mid-Monday (June 2) through the end of Tuesday (June 3), and my presentation will be the closing keynote on Tuesday from 4:15 to […]

The post Startup Community Trailblazer Brad Feld to Release New Book at GEC 2025 appeared first on Feld Thoughts.

item.title: Read Everything
item.content:encoded:
I love to read. As a kid, my idea of a good time was being in the hammock in the backyard of my house in Dallas, Texas, reading a book. My parents supported this, letting me read anything I wanted from their bookshelves (I read The Drifters at much too young an age). I loved […]

The post Read Everything appeared first on Feld Thoughts.

item.title: Dinostroids: My Journey into Vibe Coding
item.content:encoded:
Dinostroids, my first vibe-coded software project, is live. The last time I wrote any meaningful amount of production software was in 1990. At the time, I was running a software consulting company with my partner, Dave Jilk. We’d reached the point where, as we grew, he became responsible for all the software, and I handled […]

The post Dinostroids: My Journey into Vibe Coding appeared first on Feld Thoughts.
